tit.e: Seibu-kodo Hall (the west auditorium) of Kyoto University
Seibu-kodo Hall (the west auditorium) of Kyoto University
Seibu-kodo Hall (the west auditorium) of Kyoto University

sen.j: 西部講堂（せいぶこうどう）は、京都大学吉田キャンパス西部構内にある厚生施設の一つ。
sen.e: Seibu-Kodo Hall is one of the public health facilities, that is located in the west side of Kyoto University Yoshida Campus.
Seibu-Kodo Hall is one of the public health facilities, that is located on the west side of Kyoto University Yoshida Campus.
Seibu-Kodo Hall is one of the public health facilities, that is located on the western part of Kyoto University Yoshida Campus.
sen.cmt: スペース削除し表現を変えました。

sen.j: 京都大学所属のサークルのBOX（部室）等がある他、音楽コンサートをはじめとした各種イベントが不定期に開催されている。
sen.e: This hall not only has club rooms belonging to Kyoto University, but also holds various events such as music concerts at random times.
This hall not only has club rooms belonging to Kyoto University, but also holds various events such as music concerts at random times.
This hall not only has club rooms belonging to Kyoto University, but also holds various events such as music concerts at random times.

sen.j: 1937年：皇太子明仁親王（現在の今上天皇）の生誕を祝して京都帝国大学（京都大学の前身）に建築された。
sen.e: 1937: Seibu-Kodo Hall was build in Kyoto Imperial University (the former Kyoto University) to celebrate the birth of Crown Prince Akihito (present emperor).
1937: Seibu-Kodo Hall was build in Kyoto Imperial University (the former Kyoto University) to celebrate the birth of Crown Prince Akihito (present emperor).
1937: Build in Kyoto Imperial University (the former Kyoto University) to celebrate the birth of Crown Prince Akihito (present emperor).
sen.cmt: スペース削除し表現を変えました。

sen.j: 1963年：現在地に移築。
sen.e: 1963: It was relocated and reconstructed at the present place.
1963: It was relocated and reconstructed at the present place.
1963: Relocated and reconstructed at the present place.

tit.j: ロック黎明期と西部講堂
tit.e: The dawning of rock and Seibu-Kodo Hall
The dawning of rock and Seibu-Kodo Hall
The dawning of rock and Seibu-Kodo Hall

sen.j: 1969年、京大全学共闘会議の実質的な指導部の一人であった高瀬泰司（元京都府学連委員長）が、同年、京大教養部で「バリ祭」「反大学」を演出した。
sen.e: In 1969, one of the substantial leader of the All Student Joint Struggle Council of Kyoto University, Yasuji TAKASE (former chairman of Kyoto federation of students) organized "Barricade Festival" and "Anti-University" at Faculty of Liberal Arts, Kyoto University.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1969, one of the substantial leaders of the All Student Joint Struggle Council of Kyoto University, Yasuji TAKASE (former chairman of the Kyoto federation of students) organized "Barricade Festival" and "Anti-University" at Faculty of Liberal Arts, Kyoto University.

In 1969, one of the substantial leaders of the All Student Joint Struggle Council of Kyoto University, Yasuji TAKASE (former chairman of the Kyoto federation of students) organized 'Barricade Festival' and 'Anti-University' at Faculty of Liberal Arts, Kyoto University.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: そして、時計台の陥落・百万遍カルチェ・今出川解放区の壊滅（9月）のあと、残された拠点である西部講堂で活動を開始したのが、ロックと西部講堂の出会いの始まりだった。
sen.e: The meeting of rock and Seibu-Kodo Hall can be traced back to when they started their activities at their remaining base, Seibu-Kodo Hall, after fall of the clock tower and destruction of Hyakumanben Quarter liberated zone of Imadegawa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The meeting of rock and Seibu-Kodo Hall can be traced back to when they started their activities at their remaining base, Seibu-Kodo Hall, after fall of the clock tower and destruction of Hyakumanben Quarter liberated zone of Imadegawa.

The meeting of rock and Seibu-Kodo Hall can be traced back to when they started their activities at their remaining base, Seibu-Kodo Hall, after fall of the clock tower and destruction of Hyakumanben Quarter liberated zone of Imadegawa (in September).

sen.j: 西部講堂に関わっていたのは京大生だけでなく、当時、同志社大学学生放送局、京都市芸大サークル、立命館寮連合など、多くの学生が西部講堂に出入りしていた。
sen.e: Not only students of Kyoto University Students who got involved in Seibu-Kodo Hall, but also many students from Doshisya University Student Broadcast station, circles of Kyoto City University of Arts and the dormitory association of Ritsumeikan University and others went in and out this Hall.

Not only students of Kyoto University got involved in Seibu-Kodo Hall, but also many students from Doshisya University Student Broadcast station, circles of Kyoto City University of Arts and the dormitory association of Ritsumeikan University and others went in and out of this Hall.

Not only students of Kyoto University got involved in Seibu-Kodo Hall, but also many students from Doshisha University Student Broadcast station, circles of Kyoto City University of Arts and the dormitory association of Ritsumeikan University and others went in and out of this Hall.

sen.j: 木村英輝、小松辰男もその中にいた。
sen.e: Hideki KIMURA and Tatsuo KOMATSU were one of them.
Hideki KIMURA and Tatsuo KOMATSU were two of them.
Hideki KIMURA and Tatsuo KOMATSU were two of them.

sen.j: 1970年12月31日、「FUCK 70」と題したイベントが西部講堂で大音響とともに始まった。
sen.e: On December 31, 1970, the event titled "FUCK 70" started with heavy sound.
On December 31, 1970, the event titled "FUCK 70" started with a heavy sound.
On December 31, 1970, the event titled 'FUCK 70' started with a heavy sound.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 「なにが黄金の70年代や」「紅白だけが大晦日か」との主張のもと、大晦日の徹夜ロックコンサートが行われたのである。
sen.e: They held all-night rock concert on New Year's Eve, claiming "Golden 70's is nothing." and "NHK Kohaku Utagassen (NHK Year-end Grand Song Festival) is not the only event for New Year's Eve!"
They held all-night rock concert on New Year's Eve, claiming "Golden 70's is nothing." and "NHK Kohaku Utagassen (NHK Year-end Grand Song Festival) is not the only event for New Year's Eve!"
They held all-night rock concert on New Year's Eve, claiming 'Golden 70's is nothing' and 'NHK Kohaku Utagassen (NHK Year-end Grand Song Festival) is not the only event for New Year's Eve.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 住民と大学当局に大迷惑をかけながら、しかし、このイベントは、京都の大晦日の恒例行事になっていった。
sen.e: Although causing annoyance to the general public living in the vicinity and the university, this event had become an annual event on New Year's Eve in Kyoto.
Although annoying the general public living in the vicinity and the university, this event had become an annual event on New Year's Eve in Kyoto.
Although annoying the general public living in the vicinity and the university, this event had become an annual event on New Year's Eve in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: このコンサートに出演できれば、翌年、かならずマスコミに売れるぞ、とまで言われた。
sen.e: It was said that if you appeared in this concert, you would certainly make your name in the media next year.
It was said that if you appeared in this concert, you would certainly make your name in the media next year.
It was said that if you appeared in this concert, you would certainly make your name in the media next year.

sen.j: 実際はジョニー大倉、矢沢永吉らは無名のころ、さも期待されずに出演し、後年「売れた」のが実情である。
sen.e: In fact, Johnny OKURA and Eikichi YAZAWA appeared in this concert when they were unknown with no expectation, but they became popular in later years.
In fact, Johnny OKURA and Eikichi YAZAWA appeared in this concert when they were unknown with no expectation, but they became popular in later years.
In fact, Johnny OKURA and Eikichi YAZAWA appeared in this concert when they were unknown with no expectation, but they 'became popular' in later years.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: さらに、隔週土曜日のコンサートが始まった。
sen.e: Moreover, the concert on every other Saturday started.
Moreover, a concert held on every other Saturday was born.
Moreover, a concert held on every other Saturday was born.

sen.j: 「MOJO WEST」である。
sen.e: It was called "MOJO WEST."
It was called "MOJO WEST."
It was called 'MOJO WEST.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: パンフレットには、次のとおりあった。
sen.e: Here is an excerpt form its brochure; "Is MOJO WEST the group that is asks for freedom?
Here is an excerpt form its brochure; "Is MOJO WEST a group that is asking for freedom?
Here is an excerpt form its brochure as follows;
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従い分割しました。

sen.j: 「MOJO WESTとは自由を求める集団ですか。」
sen.e: Is MOJO WEST a group that is asking for freedom?'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。かっこ補足しました。

sen.j: 「いいえわれわれは秩序を求めます。」
sen.e: NO, we ask for order.
NO, we are asking for order.
No, we are asking for order.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。かっこ補足しました。

sen.j: 「それは新しい秩序であり、新しい関係であり、自律であり、責任である。」
sen.e: That is new order, new relationship, independence and responsibility.
That is the new order, a new relationship, independence and responsibility.
That is the new order, a new relationship, independence and responsibility.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。かっこ補足しました。

sen.j: 「仕事であり、作業である」
sen.e: That is job and work.
That is our job and work.
That is our job and work.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従い分割しました。

sen.j: このMOJO WESTを機に、西部講堂と学外のグループ、個人との交流がさらに広がることになる。
sen.e: MOJO WEST led to expand exchanges between external students and individuals at Seibu-Kodo Hall.
MOJO WEST led to expand exchanges between external students and individuals at the Seibu-Kodo Hall.
MOJO WEST led to expand exchanges between external students and individuals at the Seibu-Kodo Hall.

sen.j: 沢田研二のPYG。
sen.e: Kenji SAWADA's PYG was one of them.
Kenji SAWADA's PYG was one of them.
Kenji SAWADA's PYG was one of them.

sen.j: Char、村八分 (バンド)、かまやつひろし、カルメン・マキなどが西部講堂に登場。
sen.e: Char, Murahachibu (band), Hiroshi KAMAYATSU and Carmen MAKI appeared at Seibu-Kodo HALL.
Char, Murahachibu (band), Hiroshi KAMAYATSU and Carmen MAKI appeared at Seibu-Kodo HALL.
Char, Murahachibu (band), Hiroshi KAMAYATSU and Carmen MAKI appeared at Seibu-Kodo Hall.

sen.j: イベントの前夜から、新宿のヒッピーが京都へ、西部講堂へとヒッチハイクで移動してきた。
sen.e: Hippie in Shinjyuku hitchhiked to Kyoto, then to Seibu-Kodo Hall from the night before this event.
A hippie in Shinjyuku hitchhiked to Kyoto, then to Seibu-Kodo Hall from the night before this event.
A hippie in Shinjuku hitchhiked to Kyoto, then to Seibu-Kodo Hall from the night before this event.

sen.j: 1972年1月、京都府立体育館で行われた「MOJO」では、ザ・モップス、カルメン・マキ、頭脳警察ら、西部講堂ではぐくまれた奔流が街に繰り出した格好となった。
sen.e: At MOJO that was held in Kyoto Prefectural Gymnasium in January, 1972, the main stream brought up at Seibu-Kodo Hall such as the Mops, Carmen MAKI and Zuno Keisatsu performed.
sen.cmt: 奔流は、本流ではないかと思われます。「街に繰り出す」は意訳しました。
sen.e: At MOJO that was held in the Kyoto Prefectural Gymnasium in January, 1972, the main stream that were brought up in the Seibu-Kodo Hall such as the Mops, Carmen MAKI and Zuno Keisatsu performed.
At 'MOJO' that was held in the Kyoto Prefectural Gymnasium in January, 1972, the main stream that were brought up in the Seibu-Kodo Hall such as the Mops, Carmen MAKI and Zuno Keisatsu performed.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: おなじころ、京大経済学部助手の竹本信弘が朝霞自衛官殺害事件の容疑で全国指名手配になった。
sen.e: Around the same time, an assistant in Faculty of Economics, Kyoto University, Nobuhiro TAKEMOTO was placed on a nation-wanted list on suspicion of murder of the self-defense official at Asaka garrison.
Around the same time, an assistant in Faculty of Economics, Kyoto University, Nobuhiro TAKEMOTO was placed on a nation-wanted list on suspicion of murdering a self-defense official at Asaka garrison.
Around the same time, an assistant in Faculty of Economics, Kyoto University, Nobuhiro TAKEMOTO was placed on a nation-wanted list on suspicion of murdering a self-defense official at Asaka garrison.

sen.j: 竹本関連でガサ入れになったスナックのいくつかから、この「MOJO」の前売券が見つかった。
sen.e: Advance tickets for "MOJO" were found from some of the snack bars those got raided in connection with TAKEMOTO.
Advance tickets for "MOJO" were found from some of the snack bars that were raided in connection with TAKEMOTO.
Advance tickets for 'MOJO' were found from some of the snack bars that were raided in connection with Takemoto.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: コンサートは、公安警察が会場の府立体育館を囲み、緊迫した雰囲気のなかで行われた。
sen.e: While the concert venue, Kyoto Prefectural Gymnasium was surrounded by security police, and the concert was held in tense atmosphere.
While the concert venue, the Kyoto Prefectural Gymnasium was surrounded by security police, and the concert was held in a tense atmosphere.
While the concert venue, the Kyoto Prefectural Gymnasium was surrounded by security police, and the concert was held in a tense atmosphere.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: 1972年8月16日は、京大農学部グラウンドから、如意ヶ岳の大きな「五山送り火」が見える日。
sen.e: On August 16, 1972, big Gozan Okuribi (Mountain Bon Fire) of Mt. Nyoigadake was seen from the ground of Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto University on that day.
On August 16, 1972, big Gozan Okuribi (Mountain Bon Fire) of Mt. Nyoigadake was seen from the grounds of the Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto University on that day.
On August 16, 1972, big 'Gozan Okuribi' (Mountain Bon Fire) of Mt. Nyoigadake was seen from the grounds of the Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto University on that day.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: そのグラウンドで行われたコンサートが、「三里塚闘争」をスローガンにした「幻野祭」である。
sen.e: The concert, which was held at the ground under the slogan of "Sanrizuka conflict," was "Genyasai Festival"
The concert, held on the grounds under the slogan of "Sanrizuka conflict," was the "Genyasai Festival"
The concert, held on the grounds under the slogan of 'Sanrizuka conflict,' was the 'Genyasai Festival.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 三里塚の野火と、京都の大文字の送り火をつなぐコンセプトで、ウエスト・ロード・ブルース・バンド、頭脳警察、豊田勇蔵らが出演した。
sen.e: West Road Blues Band, Zuno Keisatsu and Yuzo 豊田 appeared in "Genyasai Festival" under the concept of connecting the wildfire of Sanrizuka to Daimonji no Okuribi (ceremonial bonfire of Daimonji letter).

West Road Blues Band, Zuno Keisatsu and Yuzo 豊田 appeared in the "Genyasai Festival" under the concept of connecting the wildfire of Sanrizuka to Daimonji no Okuribi (ceremonial bonfire of Daimonji letter).
West Road Blues Band, Zuno Keisatsu and Yuzo TOYODA appeared under the concept of connecting the wildfire of Sanrizuka to Daimonji no Okuribi (ceremonial bonfire of Daimonji letter).
sen.cmt: 読み確認済み漢字を削除しました。

sen.j: この京都の幻野祭に連動して、奇抜なペイントが西部講堂に出現した。
sen.e: With the holding of Genya Festival in Kyoto, Seibu-Kodo Hall was painted with unique color.
With the Genya Festival in Kyoto, Seibu-Kodo Hall was painted with a unique color.
With the Genya Festival in Kyoto, Seibu-Kodo Hall was painted with a unique color.

sen.j: 炎天下に十数人の男たちが数日間かけて、西部講堂の大屋根をライトブルーに塗り上げたのである。
sen.e: Tens of men spent several days painting the big roof of Seibu-Kodo Hall light blue under the scorching sun.
Many men spent several days painting the big roof of Seibu-Kodo Hall light blue under the scorching sun.
Many men spent several days painting the big roof of Seibu-Kodo Hall light blue under the scorching sun.

sen.j: 青い空に純白の雲が浮かび、さらに赤いオリオン座の三ツ星が大屋根に光を放った。
sen.e: On its roof, pure white clouds were floating in the blue sky, and red Orion's Belt was glowing.
On its roof, pure white clouds were floating in the blue sky, and red Orion's Belt was glowing.
On its roof, pure white clouds were floating in the blue sky, and red Orion's Belt was glowing.

sen.j: そもそもは、美大生によるスーパー・リアリスムのデザインで、三ツ星を模様として選択したものに過ぎなかった。
sen.e: In the first place, the three stars were design of super realism by the student at art university, and they just choose them as pattern.
sen.cmt: 一文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the first place, the three stars were the design of super realism by the students at the art university, and they just chose them as a pattern.
In the first place, the three stars were the design of super realism by the students at the art university, and they just chose them as a pattern.

sen.j: しかし、日本共産党がこのペイントを見て「日本赤軍の三人の兵士だと指摘」し、物議をかもすことになった。
sen.e: However, when member of the Japanese Communist Party saw this paint, they pointed out that red Orion's Belt represented three soldiers of Japanese Red Army and their remarks aroused criticism.
sen.cmt: 一文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, when members of the Japanese Communist Party saw this paint, they pointed out that the red Orion Belt represented three soldiers of the Japanese Red Army, their remarks aroused criticism.
However, when members of the Japanese Communist Party saw this paint, they pointed out that 'the red Orion Belt represented three soldiers of the Japanese Red Army,' their remarks aroused criticism.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: 日本共産党の指摘に対し、西部講堂のメンバーらは逆に開き直って、「己の生きるシルシとして、3ツの赤い星を永遠の刻印として刻むことにした」。
sen.e: Against their pointing out, member of Seibu-Kodo Hall turned defiant and decided to preserve three red stars as their own proof of living as well as eternal engraved mark.
Against their remarks, members of the Seibu-Kodo Hall turned defiant and decided to preserve three red stars as their own proof of existence as well as an eternal engraved mark.
Against their remarks, members of the Seibu-Kodo Hall turned defiant and decided 'to preserve three red stars as their own proof of existence as well as an eternal engraved mark.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: 幻野祭の当日、テルアビブの銃撃戦で亡くなった日本赤軍の京大生（奥平剛士、安田安之ら）らの追悼集会を西部構内で行い、西部講堂から農学部グラウンドまでをつなぐ、一大ページェント「幻野祭」を実現したのであった。
sen.e: On the day of "Genyasai Festival," memorial ceremony for students of Kyoto University and member of Japanese Red Army (Tsuyoshi OKUDAIRA,Yasuyuki YASUDA and others) who lost their lives in a gun battle in Tel Aviv was held at west side of the campus, and the great pageant "Genyasai Festival", connecting Seibu-Kodo Hall to the ground of Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto University, was realized.

On the day at the "Genyasai Festival," memorial ceremony for students of Kyoto University and member of Japanese Red Army (Tsuyoshi OKUDAIRA,Yasuyuki YASUDA and others) who lost their lives in a gun battle in Tel Aviv was held at west side of the campus, and the great pageant "Genyasai Festival," connecting Seibu-Kodo Hall to the grounds of Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto University, was realized.

On the day at the Genyasai Festival, memorial ceremony for students of Kyoto University and member of Japanese Red Army (Tsuyoshi OKUDAIRA, Yasuyuki YASUDA and others) who lost their lives in a gun battle in Tel Aviv was held at west side of the campus, and the great pageant 'Genyasai Festival,' connecting Seibu-Kodo Hall to the grounds of Faculty of Agriculture, Kyoto University, was realized.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変え、カンマに直しました。

sen.j: その後、西部講堂の大屋根は何度か塗り替えられたが、オリオンの三ツ星は、今も健在である。
sen.e: After that, the roof of Seibu-Kodo Hall was repainted for several times, but Orion's Belt still can be seen.
After that, the roof of Seibu-Kodo Hall had been repainted several times, but Orion's Belt can still be seen.
After that, the roof of Seibu-Kodo Hall had been repainted several times, but the tree stars of Orion's Belt can still be seen.

sen.j: ただし、色は赤色から黄色に変化している。
sen.e: However, its color was changed from red to yellow.
However, its color was changed from red to yellow.
However, its color was changed from red to yellow.

sen.j: 1975年、恒常的な運営組織（京大の公認学生団体）として西部講堂連絡協議会が発足した。
sen.e: In 1975, Seibu-kodo liaison council was launched as a constant governing organization (Kyoto University's official student group).
In 1975, the Seibu-kodo liaison council was launched as a constant governing organization (Kyoto University's official student group).
In 1975, the Seibu-kodo liaison council was launched as a constant governing organization (Kyoto University's official student group).

sen.j: 名物の炊き出し、夏祭り、フリーマーケット、無公害食品の即売なども同じころに始まった。
sen.e: Its specialties such as soup-run, summer festival, flea market and sales of pollution-free foods started at this time.
Its specialties such as soup-run, summer festival, flea markets and sales of pollution-free foods started at that time.
Its specialties such as soup-run, summer festival, flea markets and sales of pollution-free foods started at that time.

sen.j: 1976年2月4日、高瀬・木村に内田裕也から紹介される形で、フランク・ザッパとマザーズのステージが実現した。
sen.e: On February 4, 1976, Frank Vincent Zappa and the Mothers' stage was realized in the way that Yuya UCHIDA introduced them to TAKASE and KIMURA.
On February 4, 1976, Frank Vincent Zappa and the Mothers' stage was realized in the way that Yuya UCHIDA introduced them to TAKASE and KIMURA.
On February 4, 1976, Frank Vincent Zappa and the Mothers' stage was realized in the way that Yuya UCHIDA introduced them to Takase and Kimura.

sen.j: ザッパは西部講堂を見て叫んだ。
sen.e: Zappa saw Seibu-Kodo Hall and shouted.
Zappa saw the Seibu-Kodo Hall and shouted.
Zappa saw the Seibu-Kodo Hall and shouted.

sen.j: 「OH BEAUTIFUL!」。
sen.e: "Oh beautiful!"
"Oh beautiful!"
Oh beautiful!'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: その後、ザッパ言うところの、世界でもっともビューティフルでクレージーな劇場である西部講堂の存在が、彼の口コミで大物ミュージシャンらに伝わることになった。
sen.e: After that, the presence of Seibu-Kodo Hall, what Zappa called the most beautiful and crazy hall in the World, was spread to famous musicians by words of his mouth.
After that, the presence of Seibu-Kodo Hall, what Zappa called the most beautiful and crazy hall in the World, was spread to famous musicians by word of mouth.
After that, the presence of Seibu-Kodo Hall, what Zappa called the most beautiful and crazy hall in the World, was spread to famous musicians by word of mouth.

sen.j: その縁で、ストラングラーズ、XTC (バンド)、トーキング・ヘッズ、トム・ウェイツ、そしてポリス (バンド)が西部講堂に来た。
sen.e: In connection with that,The Stranglers, XTC(band), Talking Heads, Tom Waits and the Police (band) came to Seibu-Kodo Hall.
In connection with that,The Stranglers, XTC(band), Talking Heads, Tom Waits and the Police (band) came to Seibu-Kodo Hall.
In connection with that, the Stranglers, XTC (band), Talking Heads, Tom Waits and the Police (band) came to Seibu-Kodo Hall.
sen.cmt: カンマに直し、スペース削除、半角かっこにしました。

sen.j: しかし、1980年2月20日のポリス公演でウドー音楽事務所との運営上の事件が発生し、その後、大物の外人ロックタレントの公演は避けられるようになる。
sen.e: However, the operational incident occurred between Udo Artists, Inc. and Seibu-Kodo Hall at the time of the Police's performance on February 20, 1980, and after that, performances by famous foreign rock singers came to be avoided.

However, the operational incident occurred between Udo Artists, Inc. and Seibu-Kodo Hall at the time of the Police's performance on February 20, 1980, and after that, performances by famous foreign rock singers were avoided.

However, the operational incident occurred between Udo Artists, Inc. and Seibu-Kodo Hall at the time of the Police's performance on February 20, 1980, and after that, performances by famous foreign rock singers were avoided.

sen.j: 西部講堂のギグは、インディーズ・バンドにシフトしていった。
sen.e: Bands or musicians played a Gig at Seibu-Kodo Hall had been shifted to indie bands.
Bands or musicians that had played a Gig at the Seibu-Kodo Hall had been shifted to indie bands.
Bands or musicians that had played a gig at the Seibu-Kodo Hall had been shifted to indie bands.

sen.j: その中から、メジャーデビューを果たした代表が東京ロッカーズ（フリクション、リザード (バンド)）や、ZELDA、ローザ・ルクセンブルグ (バンド)（どんと）、ザ・スターリンなど。
sen.e: Some of the bands appeared in the hall such as Tokyo Rockers (Friction, Rizard (band)), ZELDA, Rosa Luxemburg (band) (Donto) and The Starlin. made a major debut.
Some of the bands appeared in the hall such as Tokyo Rockers (Friction, Rizard band), ZELDA, Rosa Luxemburg (band) (Donto) and The Starlin. made a major debut.
Some of the bands appeared in the hall such as Tokyo Rockers (Friction, Rizard band), ZELDA, Rosa Luxemburg (band) (which Donto belonged) and The Starlin made a major debut.
sen.cmt: ピリオドをのぞき、補足しました。

sen.j: ザ・スターリンのステージでは、暴れる観客から防衛するためPAが箱で囲われ、「今日は、死人が出ても知りません」とMCが叫ぶ中、歌手の遠藤みちろうが爆竹を観客に投げた。
sen.e: At the Starlin's stage, PA was covered by the box to protect it from the violent audience, and the singer, Michiro ENDO threw firecrackers at the audience, while MC shouting "I don't care if somebody died today!"

At Starlin's stage, the PA was covered with a box to protect it from the violent audience, and the singer, Michiro ENDO threw firecrackers at the audience, while MC shouting "I don't care if somebody dies today!"

At The Starlin's stage, the PA was covered with a box to protect it from the violent audience, and the singer, Michiro ENDO threw firecrackers at the audience, while MC shouting 'I don't care if somebody dies today.'
sen.cmt: 補足し、クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: そんな空間は、今も昔も西部講堂だけである。
sen.e: It is only Seibu-Kodo Hall where these kinds of events have been held all through the ages.

tit.j: ポリス事件と自主管理
tit.e: The Police incident and self control
The Police incident and self control
The Police incident and self control

sen.j: 事件の背景には、西部講堂は巷にあるような貸しホールではない、という前提を理解する必要がある。
sen.e: We need to understand there is a condition behind this incident that Seibu-Kodo Hall is different from the ordinary rental hall.
We need to understand there is a condition behind this incident and that Seibu-Kodo Hall is different from an ordinary rental hall.
We need to understand there is a condition behind this incident and that Seibu-Kodo Hall is different from an ordinary rental hall.

sen.j: 西部講堂は、「自主管理、自主運営による表現の場が確保されることこそが、文化にとってあるべき姿」と考える団体・メンバーが、西部講堂連絡協議会（西連協）を構成。
sen.e: Seibu-kodo liaison council (Sei Ren Kyo) was organized by groups and members who believed that "Securing the place for expression by self-control and self management is what culture ought to be."
Seibu-kodo liaison council (Sei Ren Kyo) was organized by groups and members who believed that "Securing the place for expression using self-control and self management is what culture ought to be."
Seibu-Kodo liaison council (Sei Ren Kyo) was organized by groups and members who believed that 'Securing the place for expression using self-control and self management is what culture ought to be.'
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせ、クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 定例会議での、企画の検討・承認を経て、初めて会場として使用できる仕組みとなっている。
sen.e: Only after the project was considered and approved in the regular meeting, the hall could be used as concert venue.
Only after the project was considered and approved in the regular meeting, could the hall be used as concert venue.
Only after the project was considered and approved in the regular meeting, could the hall be used as concert venue.

sen.j: この仕組みによれば、ウドー音楽事務所などのプロモーターは直接使用できない。
sen.e: Under this system, Udo Artists, Inc. and other promoters were not able to use the hall directly.
Under this system, Udo Artists, Inc. and other promoters were not able to use the hall directly.
Under this system, Udo Artists, Inc. and other promoters were not able to use the hall directly.

sen.j: そこで、ポリス (バンド)公演では、プロモーターから公演の話を持ちかけられた西連協を構成するメンバーの一部が急遽、公演のためだけの任意団体を結成。
sen.e: In case of the Police's stage, some members of Sei Ren Kyo, who approached by the promoter about the performance, hastily formed a voluntary group only for this stage.
In case of the Police's stage, some members of Sei Ren Kyo, who was approached by the promoter about the performance, hastily formed a voluntary group only for this stage.
In case of the Police's stage, some members of Sei Ren Kyo, who was approached by the promoter about the performance, hastily formed a voluntary group only for this stage.
sen.cmt: 半角スペースにしました。

sen.j: 企画の承認を得ることで形式を整え、開催にこぎつけた。
sen.e: After they get approval for this project as a matter of form,finally managed to hold the stage.
After they got approval for this project as a matter of form,they finally managed to hold the stage.
After they got approval for this project as a matter of form, they finally managed to hold the stage.

sen.j: ところが、当日ふたを開けてみると、会場をプロモーターが仕切り、従来の西部講堂では考えられない会場運営（多数の警備員、カメラチェック、アルコールの持ち込み禁止）が散見された。
sen.e: However, as it turned out, the promoter took control of the concert venue, and their management at the venue (a large number of security guards, no camera, and no alcohol were found here and there) was far from what usually done in Seibu-Kodo Hall.

However, as it turned out, the promoter took control of the concert venue, and their management at the venue (a large number of security guards, no cameras, and no alcohol were found here and there) was far from what usually done in Seibu-Kodo Hall.

However, as it turned out, the promoter took control of the concert venue, and their management at the venue (a large number of security guards, no cameras, and no alcohol) were found here and there was far from what usually done in Seibu-Kodo Hall.
sen.cmt: かっこの位置を変えました。

sen.j: さらに、キャパを超えるオールスタンディングの観客が詰め込まれ、危険な状態になっていた。
sen.e: Moreover, an all-standing audience that exceeded the capacity of the venue was packed into the hall, and condition of the venue became dangerous.
Moreover, an all-standing audience that exceeded the capacity of the venue was packed into the hall, and the conditions of the venue became dangerous.
Moreover, an all-standing audience that exceeded the capacity of the venue was packed into the hall, and the conditions of the venue became dangerous.

sen.j: この状態（自主管理の逸脱、商業主義と見まがう入場者数）を問題と感じた西連協のスタッフが、プロモーターに公演の中止を求めた.
sen.e: Staff of Sei Ren Kyo, who regarded this condition (deviation of self control, such attendance considered as commercialism) as a problem, asked the promoter to cancel the performance.
Staff of Sei Ren Kyo, who regarded this condition (deviation of self control, such attendance considered as commercialism) as a problem, asked the promoter to cancel the performance.
Staff of Sei Ren Kyo, who regarded this condition (deviation of self control, such attendance considered as commercialism) as a problem, asked the promoter to cancel the performance.
sen.cmt: 半角カッコにしました。

sen.j: これが、事件のあらすじである。
sen.e: That is a summary of this incident.
This summarizes this incident.
This summarizes this incident.

sen.j: この事件の後、プロモーターとの関係が強かったメンバーは西連協を去ることになった。
sen.e: After this incident, some members of Sei Ren Kyo who had a close tie with the promoter left Sei Ren Kyo.
After this incident, some members of Sei Ren Kyo, who had close ties with the promoter, left Sei Ren Kyo.
After this incident, some members of Sei Ren Kyo, who had close ties with the promoter, left Sei Ren Kyo.

sen.j: 事件の顛末は、当時、西連協が発行していた会報（「姦報」）でオープンにされ、学内では、学生自治（自主管理）の原則的なありかたとして、好意的に受容された。
sen.e: The Details of this incident was revealed in Sei Ren Kyo's newsletter "Kanpo", and what Sei Ren Kyo did was accepted in a friendly way as the nature of students' self-government (self control) in the campus.

The Details of this incident was revealed in Sei Ren Kyo's newsletter "Kanpo," and what Sei Ren Kyo did was accepted in a friendly way as the nature of students' self-government (self control) on campus.

The details of this incident was revealed in Sei Ren Kyo's newsletter 'Kanpo,' and what Sei Ren Kyo did was accepted in a friendly way as the nature of students' self-government (self control) on campus.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: これを機会に、西連協の運営が強化され、今に続いている。
sen.e: On this occasion, management of Sei Ren Kyo was strengthen, and carried on up to the present date.
On this occasion, the management of the Sei Ren Kyo was strengthen, and was carried on up to the present date.
On this occasion, the management of the Sei Ren Kyo was strengthen, and was carried on up to the present date.

sen.j: 京都府京都市左京区吉田泉殿町。
sen.e: Yoshida Izumiden-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
Yoshida Izumiden-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
Yoshida Izumiden-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 敷地はかつての旧制専門学校京都高等工芸学校（京都工芸繊維大学の前身校の一つ）の校地で、同校が松ヶ崎の現校地に移転したのち京都帝大の校地となった。
sen.e: The site of Seibu-Kodo Hall is the school land of old-education-system vocational school Kyoto Craft High School (one of the former Kyoto Institute of Technology), and after the high school was relocated to the present school land in Matsugasaki, it became the school land of Kyoto Imperial University.

The site of Seibu-Kodo Hall is the school land of the old-education-system vocational school Kyoto Craft High School (one of the former Kyoto Institutes of Technology), and after the high school was relocated to the present school land in Matsugasaki, it became the property of Kyoto Imperial University.

The site of Seibu-Kodo Hall is the school land of the old-education-system vocational school Kyoto Craft High School (one of the former Kyoto Institutes of Technology), and after the high school was relocated to the present school land in Matsugasaki, it became the property of Kyoto Imperial University.
